preface.p: A description of the grimoire. And a list of the sources used to compile it: .

description.p: Descriptions can include bold and italic text.

guideline.description: Sample general guideline from non-core book.
Guidelines can also be designated as a ritual.
Sample guideline with bold and italic text.

description.p: Sample spell from the core book. It has no source or page attributes.
This spell comes from a non-core book. It has a source and a page number.
Ritual spells have a ritual="true" attribute.
Spells can include one or more requisites. Requisites can have a free="true" attribute if they do not affect the level of the spell

description.flavour: This is flavour text. It does not explain the effects of the spell but rather world colour for the spell.

description.p: Spells can have a faerie="true" attribute to designate a faerie spell.
Spells that are general have a type of general and the level says GENERAL.
